Text: Hello, Lady Alpha.

Thank you for making time to see me, Beta. There's
something I could only ask you in person.
Not at all. So, what is it you want to ask?

Beta, are you aware of the legend of the Three
Heroes?
The Three Heroes...?
Well, just the general gist of it...
Three heroes fought to slay the demon Diablos—

And in the end, one of the heroes, Olivier, succeeded
in striking down the fiend and sealing it away.
...Is that all you know?
Is that all? Let's see—

The heroes were Olivier, an elf, Lili, a
therianthrope, and then Freya, a human...

After sealing Diablos, Olivier became a paladin of
the Church. Lili traveled the world as an archbishop
of the Church, helping those in areas devastated by
the demon...

...while Freya became leader of the people who would
go on to found what is now the Midgar Kingdom. But
that much is all common knowledge.
Lady Alpha...?
The hero Olivier...

In the Holy Teachings known by the general public,
Olivier is male—

But in elven villages, the "original history" has been
passed down by oral tradition among certain clans—

It was told to me so very long ago that I only
vaguely remember the details...

...but in that version of history, Olivier was a
woman.
Lili and Freya were also said to be women, not men...
...But you've heard all this before.

Yes. The truths our lord enlightened me to and the
elven oral histories all indicate that the three
heroes were, in fact, women.
And possession is proof of heroic ancestry.

The possessed were once shown great care, gratitude,
and admiration as children of the world's saviors.

Only now, there is no gratitude—because someone has
twisted history around...!
This brings us to the heart of the matter...

The statue of the elven swordswoman that reacted to
my touch in that Sanctuary...

The techniques she used were of an ancient style of
swordplay left by Olivier and passed on in elven lands.
But then...!

I'm sure of it. What were once faint memories came
back to me as clear as day the moment I saw those
techniques.

But...then that would mean the swordswoman we
encountered was...

...Yes, as you're thinking, this is all nothing more
than a guess, and could even be called wishful
thinking.

After all, it's never been certain whether there is
indeed a connection between Olivier and the
Sanctuary, or rather the Cult facility.
Still, this would indicate there IS some link!

...I take it this means we need to make a concerted
investigation into what the world doesn't know about
the Three Heroes.

Correct. There's no way of knowing if we'll turn up
anything, but can I still ask for your assistance?
...Of course! I shall see it done, Lady Alpha.

Thank you, Beta. I also have Zeta on the task, so
coordinate your efforts with her.

I'll gather some materials that should prove useful
for the investigation right away—

...The teachings of the elven villages were never meant
to be shared with others, but it seems there's no need
to keep them a secret any longer.

But as for you, Beta... I want you to see with your
own eyes, to seek out and learn the truth for
yourself.

The truth that the swordswoman we encountered just
may be...none other than the hero Olivier.
